title: Practitioner Competency Enhancement Course for a Sustainable Future

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental social science concepts
context.additional_context: Project-based education enabling practicing professionals to understand sustainability science principles and develop actionable solutions for daily life/work environments.

learning_goals: Develop sustainable project plans following the five phases of the ADDIE model (Analysis, Design, Development, Implementation, Evaluation)
Demonstrate problem-solving abilities related to sustainability by applying Bloom’s Taxonomy’s six levels (Remember-Understand-Apply-Analyze-Evaluate-Create)
Identify specific sustainability issues connected to the local community (e.g., waste management, energy conservation) and propose actionable improvement plans
Demonstrate statistically significant enhancement in cognitive (knowledge) and affective (attitude) competencies related to sustainability through pre- and post-assessments
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
